Docs.summary: Adds a handler for an event of a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create a delegate, you identify the method that handles the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. Unless you remove the delegate, the event handler is called whenever the event occurs. Multiple delegates can be added to handle an event. For more information about event-handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
## Examples Handlers are added and removed using the following code. This code example is part of the Send Email SDK sample and is from the SendMailActivity.cs file. For more information, see [Send Email Activity Sample](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bfb5939e-60a9-4037-af4e-2cea9e654669).

## Remarks This member is typically used in property gets to furnish the value of the named dependency value.
## Examples The following code shows how to use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.GetValue%2A> to return the value represented by a named dependency property in the context of get and set. This code example is part of the Send Email SDK sample and is from the SendMailActivity.cs file. For more information, see [Send Email Activity Sample](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bfb5939e-60a9-4037-af4e-2cea9e654669).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is useful inside the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.GetValue%2A> override implementation. Typically, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.GetValue%2A> override code invokes the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.GetValueBase%2A>, and then adds additional code.
For implementing the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.GetValue%2A> override, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.PropertyMetadata> can be used in <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty.Register%2A>/<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty.RegisterAttached%2A> calls.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Provided as a convenient direct method for removing an event delegate.
When you create a delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. Unless you remove the delegate, the event handler is called whenever the event occurs. For more information about event-handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
## Examples Handlers are added and removed using the following code. For more information, see [Send Email Activity Sample](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bfb5939e-60a9-4037-af4e-2cea9e654669).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetBinding(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty dependencyProperty, class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityBind bind) cil managed
Public Sub SetBinding (dependencyProperty As DependencyProperty, bind As ActivityBind)

Docs.summary: Sets the for the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> sets the value directly to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty>. Similarly, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.AddHandler%2A> adds a handler directly to properties of type event.
These methods are exclusive when they are called for the same property. If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetBinding%2A> is called, then the values previously set using <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> (<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.AddHandler%2A> in events) are disregarded. The same is true the other way around: <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> (<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.AddHandler%2A>) resets the binding assigned with <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetBinding%2A>.
## Examples The following code shows how to create activities and add them as children to a composite activity and includes setting the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.CompositeActivity.CanModifyActivities%2A> permission for this type.
In addition, the use of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetBinding%2A> method is illustrated.
This code example is part of the Throw SDK sample and is from the ThrowWorkFlow.cs file. For more information, see [Using Throw](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa5b9546-ec95-4e43-8337-20e26f8d71cc).
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#215](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets19.cs#215)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#215](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets19.vb#215)]

The associated with the is read-only, is metadata, or is not bindable.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetValue (System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty dependencyProperty, object value);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetValue(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty dependencyProperty, object value) cil managed
Public Sub SetValue (dependencyProperty As DependencyProperty, value As Object)

Docs.param: The to set the value to.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of the to the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetBinding%2A> sets a binding for the dependency property.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> sets a value directly to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty> (similarly, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.AddHandler%2A> adds a handler directly to properties of type event).
These methods are exclusive when they are called for the same property. If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetBinding%2A> is called, then the values previously set using <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> (<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.AddHandler%2A> in events) are disregarded. The same is true the other way around: <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> (<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.AddHandler%2A>) resets the binding assigned with <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetBinding%2A>.
## Examples The following code shows how a dependency property is set within a dependency object using <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A>.
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#166](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets11.cs#166)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#166](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets11.vb#166)]

.method public hidebysig instance void SetValueBase(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty dependencyProperty, object value) cil managed
Public Sub SetValueBase (dependencyProperty As DependencyProperty, value As Object)

Docs.param: The to be set to the .
The that becomes the value of the .
Docs.summary: Sets the value of the to the specified , bypassing the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is useful inside the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> override implementation. Typically, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> override code would do some custom logic before calling the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValueBase%2A> method.
For setting a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> override, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.PropertyMetadata> can be used in <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty.Register%2A>, or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty.RegisterAttached%2A> calls.

MemberSignature.Value: Custom Event Disposed As EventHandler Implements System.ComponentModel.IComponent

Docs.summary: Represents the method that handles the Disposed event of a component.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create a Disposed delegate, you identify the method that handles the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property UserData As IDictionary
public: property System::Collections::IDictionary ^ UserData { System::Collections::IDictionary ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets an that associates custom data with this class instance.
Docs.value: A dictionary that acts as an extensibility hook for developers to manipulate declarations for a design tool and associate custom data with individual activity declarations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is a `metaproperty`, which means it is immutable at run time. `Metaproperties` do not change after a property instance is created at run time, so the property must be set to a literal value at design time.
This property is not used in the default <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> declaration implementations provided by Windows Workflow Foundation. This collection is not serialized; data that the collection contains is not persisted from design time to run time.
